title: Ticket #3217: Macros that are prefixes of "DOLLAR" are not recognized
description: It turns out a macro that is a proper prefix of "DOLLAR" (e.g., $(D), $(DO), etc) would never be recognized by the macro configuration code. I have a fix that I am pushing into V7_8-branch.
remarks:
2012-Sep-05 05:06:46 by nwp:
To see the bug, insert the following into a condor_config: 
DO=$(SPOOL)
JOB_QUEUE_LOG=$(DO)/job_queue.log
Run condor_schedd -f -t and watch the schedd try to open $(DO)/job_queue.log. (The literal file name, not the macro expansion).

2012-Sep-05 13:13:32 by johnkn:
fix looks ok to me.
check_ins:
2012-Sep-11 12:03   Check-in [33313]: rewrite of 7.8.4 version history item of esoteric bug ===GT=== #3217 (By Karen Miller )
2012-Sep-05 12:25   Check-in [33282]: Version history for #3217 (By Nathan W. Panike )
2012-Sep-04 23:10   Check-in [33273]: Check the length of a macro when comparing against "DOLLAR" #3217 I discovered this while looking into gt3196. Turns out the find_config_macro function would never identify $(D), $(DO), $(DOL), etc., as a configuration macro. (By Nathan W. Panike )
creator: nwp
